title: Engagement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network
Interview Descriptions: I went through a phone interview which went great. I was then interviewed in person- again went great. Both times, I was offered a range of salary and with my experience, I was on the high range of that. I was offered a position, which I accepted. Everything was great until I spoke to HR. HR was absolutely unprofessional and that's coming from someone currently in school for HR via SHRM. She gave me one LOW BALL OFFER. When I explained, I spoke about this with the department and that I had 12 years experience, she tried to belittle me by saying that " you only have NINE years experience" lol. I reminded her I had TWO children inbetween and even though I did, I still remained EMPLOYED during and regardless that I was not entry level. For someone in HR, she was absolutely unprofessional and confrontational. She said she would speak to the department and get back to me. There was silence for about four days! I reached out to the department and explained what happened. She emailed me again (in writing) the salary range and again, it was a range I was happy with. It was BOE and I had experience! Then HR sent me an email RESCINDING THEIR OFFER because I was "over the pay range." There was absolutely NO negotiation, there was no communication it was disorganized and disappointing. As someone who worked in the field, again for twelve years in management positions; it's quite disappointing and they should quite honestly be embarrassed at themselves. I had higher hopes for such a big health network. When I emailed HR- I asked kindly- why they rescinded their offer, when the department sent me an email that morning- with a range I was happy with? I was met with silence. Perhaps other departments and other people in HR are better- but there is so much mismanagement going on there; that honestly I dodged a bullet. Clearly they do not want to pay people what they are worth and expect you to accept anything they throw at you- even if it is below what you are worth and you were offered a position, with a pay range you WERE happy with.

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Although this was a negative experience for me, the interview process itself was very organized and quick.  

I had applied and heard back from the VP of the group within a couple days.  We set up a virtual interview and I was very impressed by the VP.  Although she didn't think I was a good fit for the role I applied, she saw value in me and offered me a different position that sounded good to me.  A few days later I spoke with the hiring manager, who was also very nice, if not desperate for more people because of high workload.

The VP and I agreed on a number, and mentioned we were both flexible and would meet somewhere in the middle.  She reached out to me and said to expect an offer.  I was shocked a week later when the offer was 30% below what we had discussed, and would result in a huge pay cut for me.  I reached out to the VP to ask where to disconnect was, and to her credit she responded quickly and said she was 'disappointed in the offer she could extend.'

Here's what happened: HR overrode her decision and decided to lowball me based on an internal "equity comparison/compensation" pricing model, that reduces people to numbers on a spreadsheet and probably needs to be updated post-covid.  It astounds me that the same companies that are desperate to hire workers and complain that "no one wants to work" will turn right around and lowball people.  It's even more shocking to me that an HR department, who never even had a conversation with me prior to calling me to extend an offer, would override a VP's decision as to the value I bring to her team.  Why did you put that VP in her role if you don't trust her judgement?  Clearly, they just took a quick look at my resume for my age, and decided I wasn't worth what the VP and I both agreed I was worth.  Given what they are probably spending on travelling nurses and contractors these days, I find that downright insulting.

And, gee, I wonder why the hiring manager is so desperate for more people.  This position has been open for weeks and I keep seeing it get reposted.  But, hey, if you want to hire cheap labor, only to have them leave two years from now when they realize how underpaid they are, who am I to tell you how to run your company?

If you apply for a job here, expect to be lowballed by HR - it won't matter what you and the hiring manager agreed to.  It's a waste of your time and you should look elsewhere.
Interview Questions: They asked about my background and leadership style while managing different teams.  It was a very good, organic conversation.

Interview Descriptions: First interview with nurse interviewer about 2-3 questions like “tell us about a time when” and “why do you want to work in healthcare” and then they talk to you about open units. Then a interview with unit director, same type of questions and shows you around the unit. Simple interview process very laid back.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when a coworker did not have the same values/beliefs as you and how did you rectify the situation

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: i went in for a group interview with 9 other people first. Then it was broken down into what your interests are and then they let you know what positions have opening to interview for. The recruiter is awesome and is great about getting you set up in your field of interest. Then i interviewed for the floor i wanted.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a conflict with other staff members?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied a month ago and on their website it said I was no longer being considered for the position, but they called me a few weeks later and scheduled appointment. I went in and there were 3 staff members, asked me normal straight forward questions, very friendly which made it easy to relax. Interview lasted 40 minutes.
Interview Questions: What is one thing that you liked the most about your previous job?

title: Professional Clinical Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Received interview invite by phone. Panel interview in front of 5 staff members.  Everyone was very nice, but I have a very a our taste in my mouth due to the lack of communication and/or indication that I was not selected.  Totally unacceptable.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in healthcare?

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by email and asked to pick from a variety of dates to come in for a group interview. The group interview itself was very casual and relaxed. We went into a conference room and were told about the hospital and the GN opportunity. Both people present spoke to their history at the hospital and then asked us to tell them about ourselves, what made us choose nursing as a profession, etc. After a few more questions we were given a list of positions available for GNs and asked to choose which we thought we'd like the most. Those who made it through the initial group interview then had a second interview set up on another date with the unit director of their choice unit. 

That interview was also laid back, with behavioral questions and a description of the unit and how they run. The research project required of BSN GNs was discussed, as well as the orientation process. I was asked why I became a nurse, why I was interested in the unit I selected, and where I hoped to be in a year.
Interview Questions: Describe your hardest day as a student nurse.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Philadelphia, PA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: process was long and tedious may be worthwhile if you are interested in the position. required two meetings and a phone screening. met with various personnel in the health care field. took a while to hear back but again consider the value of the opportunity
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about your experience ?

title: Registration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: they call you in for a face to face interview. then if you are accepted they will call you with an offer and if you accept they will schedule your physical. you must do the physical and pass the drug test or you will not be accepted. they will also send you your acceptance letter with other things you have to do like your fingerprinting and background check. my process went by very quickly within a month but I think that was because they were rushing to fill the position. I had my interview on 2/28 for start date of 3/14.
Interview Questions: How would handle a customer that has been waiting long for an appointment and has a complaint

title: PSNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: 2 step process, interview with recruiter then director of chosen unit. The one on one interview is where I believe you get the chance to shine, so come prepared with questions about the organization, and how you can expect to see professional growth for yourself and the organization
Interview Questions: Describe a time you were challenged or had to demonstrate leadership

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application on a Monday, heard back Friday about an interview. It was supposed to be a group interview, but I was the only one that signed up for the time slot so my experience was a little different than others may have been. Initial interview very laid back, relaxed. Second interview is required.
Interview Questions: Name a time that you had to advocate for a patient or yourself.

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with about 6 other candidates. Question was asked and we all took turns responding to them. Very laid back. Next you choose what floor you wanted to interview for and interviewed with the director of that unit and a couple other staff nurses. From there you toured the unit. I received responses day of for both interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult clinical experience

title: Technical Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, successfully completed "Teamwork & Observation" test at CareerLink, received a phone call from recruiter within a few days regarding my "preferences" for employment (hours, shift, location)... received a phone call a few days later for an interview. Scheduled interview and received job offer 2 days later. Entire process took 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe an experience where you couldn't make a customer happy and how you resolved the situation?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Reading, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview was in the middle of August. Did not heard anything back till the middle of September to come in for a 2nd interview. The manager was very down to earth and made the process easier. Received offer in October and negotiated the pay rate and they were open to my negotiation. Accept offer.
Interview Questions: What is your minimum pay rate that you will accept for this position?

title: Human Service Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Lehigh Valley, PA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple yet direct questions. Two people did the interview.  Had a second interview with department head.  Asked about prior work experience,  criminal history, etc...Interviewers made you feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you went out of your way at your job?

title: Speech Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network
Interview Descriptions: After applying and attending a invite only event for potential job opportunities I followed up and was invited for interview.  Interview was with SLP and OT and was very relaxed.  Following the interview I followed up with an email and never heard back.  It took months to find out that I was no longer being considered for the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience with handling a patient or family member who did not agree with your recommendations.

title: EMS Leasion Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
group interview  round robin questions regarding the position stayed on topic question where about my experience and how I could help the hospital maintain EMS relationships.

The job was to help encourage EMS to see the hospital as a resource for training.
Interview Questions: how would you get EMS groups to work with the hospital

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a career at LVHN before I attended a nurse recruitment event. During the event, we were able to meet with several nurse managers and explore different units. At the end of the event, we completed a survey in which rated our top three interests (ie. ED, Burn Unit, Med Surg).  We were told that the HR department would reach out to us about interview offers within one week of the event. I was contacted within one week by an HR representative, who asked me a few more in-depth questions about my desire to work at LVHN and the units I mentioned in the survey. The HR representative was able to arrange an interview with the nurse manager on my first unit of choice. Depending on when you apply and the availability of Graduate Nurse positions on the unit determines whether or not you will receive your first choice. The interview process was very relaxed and I was able to shadow an nurse on the unit the day of my interview. I promptly received a job offer within 3 business days. The entire process was very organized and prompt, and the employees were very friendly and helpful.
Interview Questions:
Why would you like to work for LVHN?
Where do you see yourself in 5-10 years?
Do you have any questions about our unit?

title: Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Average interview, this position was for an internship just for the summer so it was easier than other job interviews I have had. Basic interview questions that I have been asked before.
Interview Questions: What do you do in a difficult situation with a client?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: You have to apply online. From there its goes to HR and if you qualify in general your application is sent to the hiring manager. You receive a call to schedule an interview. Depending on the position you will have a second interview. If you are hired you receive a call informing how much they will pay and whether you choose to accept the offer. From there they send instructions on everything that has to be done before your first day via email. If you ever have questions you can always call the person who initially contacted you or your hiring manager. It was an easy process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to take care of an upset patient. What happened and how did you handle it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network
Interview Descriptions: New nurses go through a 2 interview process. First is a group interview followed by a one on one unit interview with nurse manager if you make it through the group interview.
Interview Questions: Not fond of group interview. Only hospital I know that does this

title: Administrative Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very good and informative. Showed me the area I was going to be working staff was very friendly. My interview was very comfortable and friendly I just knew I wanted to work for this hospital I had read reviews and talked with employee who worked at Lehigh Valley and knew this is were I wanted to work.
Interview Questions: Something about home life and how I would handle.

title: Administrative Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Phone call to discuss interests. Ome week later call to come in that friday for interview. Interview was easy, very friendly. Met the staff on the unit. The monday after that friday call from hr with offer. Accepted offer tons of paperwork and background check.
Interview Questions: tell me about the teams you have been on

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and interview process can take awhile but can also be fast. Graduate nurses are hired at certain times of the year. Groups of new nurses are hired at a time so they can go through the orientation process all at once.
Interview Questions: What influenced you to become a nurse?

title: Exercise Physiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Bethlehem, PA)
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted application online.  
Phone call to come in for an interview.  Interviewed by head of department, as well as VP overseeing the department.  Lots of general interview questions about education, experience, internship.
Phone call to come in for second interview.  Interviewed by head of department, as well as the new director of the department.  More specific interview questions about what type of people I expect to work with, as well as patient care and research questions.
Phone call from HR with job offer.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult or unexpected.  Just honest questions and honest answers.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was very thorough.  First met with HR RN, who asked many good questions. Example: Tell me about an experience with a patient that was difficult.  Tell me about an experience that exceeded your expectations.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: One interview with several people. Seemed like a standard interview. Nothing out of the ordinary. The questions were standard and not challenging at all.  The manager was more interested in getting people onboard quickly.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back, one on one. Very brief conversation with HR with information about the job to make sure I was still interested. Met with a supervisor within the security department and talked about the job, previous experience, interests, and a few situational questions. Not very formal, met in the lobby on some couches. Overall pleasant.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: They ask you a series of questions which are required by Human Resources. Not too hard. Just be prepared and honest. Human resources moved pretty fast regarding checking clearances and references. They were helpful and communicated well. Overall the process was easy going. Started job within two weeks of interview.
Interview Questions: Explain some of you skills and attributes that would benefit the case management department.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Had a group interview for new nurse graduates, there was about 6 in my group. The first group interview was more to get a feel for personality and compassion. At the end of that group everyone choose the position they wanted from the open available slots. An interview was then set up with the manager of the floor chosen. This interview was easy overall.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to go into the profession of nursing?

title: Per Diem RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Rigorous. Lots of steps to go through but also lots of help available to navigate it. 
It starts with an on-line assessment which seemed to measure your degree of cultural competence and tolerance. If you pass this, your references are thoroughly checked and you then go on to an in-person interview. 
If hired, you go on to get a physical in the network, finger printed&cleared, and lastly, meet with HR to explain benefits. That whole process took about 6 weeks start to finish.
Interview Questions: The actual interview was very pleasant and casual as it takes place by the hiring unit manager. The difficult part was the general hospital orientation followed by a general nursing orientation. It's long and, as a nurse, you are expected to take a generalized pharmacology exam even if you are not giving meds in your position. To be fair, you are offered resources to help you through it and are offered retakes should you fail. In my orientation class, many experienced nurses had to retake this test at least once...including me. I recognize the need for such an evaluation, but it might make more sense to have it be unit specific.

title: Technical Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: 3.5 months! LVHN hired an outside firm to complete background checks. Numerous times I had to send te same documents to both the background company and LVHN, very frustrating. Interview was a breeze. Some report it was not so comfortable. They require one to interview with a unit director. However, that director will not be your boss!  After you are trained they throw you on a different unit with a director and management staff that have no idea who you are...it's like interviewing all over again!
Interview Questions: I was not expecting to have an assessment test. The test was conducted at the PA Department of Labor and Industry (unemployment office).  It was video and PowerPoint. It was almost demeaning.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview with HR to determine interests, interview with Unit Manager from Floor of interest. Was offered job in critical care unit.  Trained on unit day shift for 6 months, went night shift towards the end of that time and for two weeks trained on nights.  Additionally had Critical care classes and certifications to obtain.  Started as a graduate nurse.  Hired directly into critical care without med surge experience.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult patients

title: Technical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: The staff are nice and their working environment is so good. Their technology was focused on Windows systems. Not too much design projects. The employees were asked to use the tech tools well.
Interview Questions: If there is no projects to do, what do you like to do in the workplace?

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh Valley Hospital and Health Network (Allentown, PA) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: Hired from contractor to full-time position.  Multiple rounds of in person interviews with different management and team members.  HR Process is not very solid, but once you get past the HR department, it gets much better.  Management will often omit details about things like required oncall or bonus structure, so it is best to ask.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself working in a healthcare environment?
